snippet: The agency had weak management and undertrained staff, and it repeatedly missed opportunities to identify the deadly defect at the heart of a large recall of G.M. vehicles.
abstract: Transportation Dept unveils long-awaited audit of the National Highway Traffic Safety Admin, revealing chronic failure to root out problems and hold carmakers accountable as dangerous defects emerged in millions of vehicles; bleak account cites weak management, undertrained staff and shoddy review protocols that led to extensive lapses; includes agency's repeated failure to identify ignition switch problem that led to at least 114 deaths.
lead_paragraph: The agency had weak management and undertrained staff, and it repeatedly missed opportunities to identify the deadly defect at the heart of a large recall of G.M. vehicles.

headline.main: Federal Auditor Finds Broad Failures at N.H.T.S.A.
headline.print_headline: Audit Faults Auto Safety Regulator for Failures
